pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.1: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.2: the monks from the group of six tickled one of the monks from the group of seventeen to make him laugh.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.3: He fainted, and not being able to catch his breath, he died.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.4: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.5: “How can the monks from the group of six tickle a monk to make him laugh?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.6: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.9: “… Foolish men, how can you tickle a monk to make him laugh?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.10: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.11: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.12.1: ‘If a monk tickles another, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.1.2: if one who is fully ordained touches another who is fully ordained, body to body, with the aim of making him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.4: If, with his own body, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.5: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.6: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.7: If, by releasing something, he touches the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.8: If, by releasing something, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.9: If, by releasing something, he touches what is released by the other monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.10: If, with his own body, he touches the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.11: If, with his own body, he touches what is connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.12: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.13: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches what is connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.14: If, by releasing something, he touches the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.15: If, by releasing something, he touches what is connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.16: If, by releasing something, he touches what is released by the someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.17: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.18: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.19: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.2: if he is not aiming to make him laugh;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.3: if he touches him when there is a need;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.5: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.6: The second rule, the training rule on tickling, is finished.
